definition: root of the trouble/cause of the ruin
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: His wealth proved a curse to him.
This is both a blessing and a curse.
sentences.chinese: 這既是一種幸運也是一個禍根。

sentences.english: Wet of fine, weeds are always regarded as the bane of a horticulturist's life.
sentences.chinese: 不管天晴下雨，雜草對園藝家來說總是禍根。

sentences.english: The show's popularity has also been a curse.
sentences.chinese: 節目的流行反而成了禍根。

sentences.english: Sagoro's greatest bane was his criminal older brother, Venco.
sentences.chinese: 薩戈羅最大的禍根就是他的罪犯哥哥文科。

sentences.english: What happened at Hockenheim must have rung bells with you.
sentences.chinese: 禍根海姆的事一定讓你回想起什麼。

sentences.english: Indeed, central banks laid the foundations for today's stagflation.
sentences.chinese: 的確，爲今天的滯脹種下禍根的正是各國央行。

sentences.english: On the other side, there were those who branded them as the “curse” of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，又有人污衊他們是這個國家的“禍根”。

sentences.english: The exclusive right of the Empress Dowager Dou he was very angry, and determined to get rid of this curse for the country.
sentences.chinese: 對竇太后的專權他十分氣憤，決心爲國除掉這一禍根。

sentences.english: In some cases historic resentments are at the base.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情況下，歷史積怨埋下了禍根。

sentences.english: But alcohol was to be his undoing.
sentences.chinese: 但酒精註定是他的禍根。

sentences.english: Avarice is the bane to happiness.
sentences.chinese: 貪婪是損毀幸福的禍根。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to engage in fraudulent activities (idiom)/skulduggery/to hoodwink people/to cheat sb audaciously
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable/item sold at a loss
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
